name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 7% Ni | nickel concentrate, 7% Ni | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23467/documentation

This dataset is based on the following publication:  Deng, S. Y., & Gong, X. Z. (2018). Life Cycle Assessment of Nickel Production in China. Materials Science Forum, 913, 1004-1010. doi:10.4028/www.scientific.net/MSF.913.1004 . Specific modifications were made in order to make the dataset more transparent.The publication deals with the pyrometallurgical production of electrolytic nickel (99.98% concentrated) by sulfide ore (1% concentration). This activity represents the production of nickel concentrate (6.78% beneficiated) from nickel sulfidic ore (1% concentration). 

The activity starts with the mining of sulfidic nickel ore from the ground.  

The activity ends with the production of nickel concentrate, 6.78% beneficiated.

No allocation is applied.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data are considered representative of current production practices.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Dataset valid for the entire corresponding region.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Underground pit mining, crushing, grinding and beneficiation activities (through xanthates) are performed to produce the nickel concentrate.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data are assumed to represent the average production of nickel concentrate in China.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
This dataset is based on the following publication:(Deng & Gong, 2018)Deng, S. Y., & Gong, X. Z. (2018). Life Cycle Assessment of Nickel Production in China. Materials Science Forum, 913, 1004-1010. doi:10.4028/www.scientific.net/MSF.913.1004. According to the authors of this publication the majority of the data originated from national statistics [1], or process design data [2]. The calculation of the emissions was based on emissions factors on the 2006 IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories. The inventory of electricity, coke, diesel and other basic energy come from Boxue Sun`s results [3]. The sources used for the provision of the dataset is listed below:
[1] China nonferrous metals industry association, The almanac of China nonferrous metals in-dustry, 2011-2015[M], The Almanac of China Nonferrous Metals Industry, 2011-2015.

[2] Heavy metal smelting design manual (copper nickel roll)[M], Metallurgical Industry Press, 2007.

[3] B.X. Sun, Z.R. Nie, Y. Liu, X.Z. Gong, F. Gao, Z.H. Wang, Research on life cycle CO2 emmissions of energy carriers in China[J], Materials Research Innovations, 18 (2014), 56-61. 

Inputs from the environment, infrastructural input and process outputs such as sulfidic tailings and wastewater have been assumed from the author of the dataset for compliance with the Ecoinvent guidelines and for mass balance purposes. Further details can be found at the comments of each individual exchange.

flow.name: Nickel
flow.category: Elementary flows/Resource/in ground

exchanges.description: Total particulate matter emmited is 0.000633589 kg (calculated value after dataset disagreggation). The mass fractions for PM<2.5, PM2.5 - 10 and PM>10 are 4.9%, 44.2% and 50.8% respectively and are based on the values of table 5.8 of the Classen report ''Life Cycle Inventories of Metals'' data v2.1 (2009) contained in the section Part IV Nickel page 21.
